intro: Spergularia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and dunes. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Spergularia laxiflora is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in coastal and semi-arid regions.
